KnowledgeBase.Title: Example Symbol compareNE 002
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: compare compareEQ compareGT compareGE compareLT compareLE

Example.Description: These examples use the compareNE function to compare two Symbols and return the Boolean value, true or false. In these examples, lowercase characters in the Symbols are compared as against uppercase characters.In the ASCII table, uppercase characters are represented by 65 to 90 while lowercase characters are repsented by 97 to 122. Using this table, lowercase characters have greater value than uppercase characters.

Syntax.Note:
In this example, lowercase "h" in the first symbol has a higher value in the ASCII
table than uppercase "H", therefore the symbols are not equal.
